column4: I need to remove a package to upgrade to edgy... i tried hard to remove it with apt get but it wouldnt work... now i want that the package managers ignore the package i.e. that it doesnt appear in the list anymore can somebody help me to let this happen =)?
i need somebodies help to remove a package without using the package manager because those wouldnt work....
what package?  Can you pastebin the error you get? Have you tried using dpkg?
can you pastebin the error messages you are getting?
I am quite sure it wouldnt help but i can yes...
here it is one of several attempshttp://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/31214/
pastebin
pastebin /var/lib/dpkg/info/spring-basedata.postrm
ok one moment
damn this folder is full =)
you can also try creating the /usr/share/spring/mods directory yourself and rerunning it.  Since it seems that was your last error
the problem is the basedata removing causes spring/mods to be removed...
so if you create it, you get back to the postrm error?
k, we can probably edit the postrm script
do you know if you had any package that provided that command?  (spring-modupdate)
i had a package called spring scripts but not spring mod update
here is the paste of  /var/lib/dpkg/info/spring-basedata.postrm http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/31215/
and you are certain that the scripts package didn't provide mod-update?
scripts is installed at the moment
well you see your postrm?  Just tell it not to run spring-modupdate
ok i have to delete one line and then run it again and it will work?
maybe, I'm not sure if bash complains about case statements that are empty.  You could just tell it to run 'true', or find out if it matters taht it is empty
